articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Walmart India says eight senior staff among 56 executives fired
articles.description: Walmart Inc , the world's largest retailer, has fired 56 of its India executives including eight from senior management, Krish Iyer, President and CEO of its India unit, said on Monday.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI (Reuters) - Walmart Inc (WMT.N), the world’s largest retailer, has fired 56 of its India executives including eight from senior management, Krish Iyer, President and CEO of its India unit, said on Monday. 
In a statement emailed to Reuters, Iyer sa… [+332 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: NBA roundup: Irving shines in return as Nets blast Hawks
articles.description: Kyrie Irving scored 21 points in his first game in nearly two months as the Brooklyn Nets never trailed and cruised to a 108-86 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Sunday night in New York.
articles.content:
Kyrie Irving scored 21 points in his first game in nearly two months as the Brooklyn Nets never trailed and cruised to a 108-86 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Sunday night in New York.

articles.author: David Henry
articles.title: As businesses hold back, U.S. consumers seen boosting big banks' profits
articles.description: Consumer lending is expected to propel profits for big U.S. banks when they unveil fourth-quarter results this week, though stress in corporate lending and uneven capital markets may cast a shadow over results.
articles.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Consumer lending is expected to propel profits for big U.S. banks when they unveil fourth-quarter results this week, though stress in corporate lending and uneven capital markets may cast a shadow over results.

articles.author: Liz Hampton
articles.title: RPT-Three years after $1 bln Venezuela deal, U.S. oilfield firm shuts doors
articles.description: An Oklahoma oilfield company that played a central role in Venezuela's high profile attempt to convince the world it could halt production declines at its dilapidated oilfields has shut its doors, according to three people familiar with the matter.
articles.content:
(Repeats story first published on Friday) 
By Liz Hampton and Lawrence Delevingne
